results.content: Interesting and informative.  In-depth presentation of essential material provided foundational knowledge of CSS.  Course covered styling text, complex selectors, styling for forms and buttons, box model, CSS positioning, responsive design and transitions & animations. A great course without wasting a lot of time.   The exercises and course guide provided a means of hands-on learning.  I definitely recommend this course!

results.content:
I thought I knew a fair bit about css before taking this course!  It turns out there were huge gaps in my knowledge and I now appreciate there is a lot more!  Complex selectors; position; transition and animation all captured my imagination.

The course itself is well structured and the quality of presentation is so professional!  The pace was ideal for me and I particularly liked the opportunity for practical application of knowledge gained at each stage.

results.content: Mark as an instructor explains things  clearly and with normal language great for beginners. Lots of examples are show on how tags are used if you follow along with the lesson videos. At the end of each lesson you get 2 exercises. One you have to debug the code for an example similar to the one in the lesson video.  Second is a project that you have to create on your own that reinforces what you just learned and lets the information sink in. Highly recommend for new learners and a great refresher for veterans to get certification for proof of skills.

results.content:
Great course!  Framework Television produces very high quality products and Mark's courses are the best among them. An outstanding feature of his courses is a concise and clear presentation of the framework of the material, as well as a very competent presentation method - the main code patterns are repeated from lecture to lecture and by the end of the course they are well remembered without any special effort. 
In this course,  there is an accompanying text material with explanations and exercises for each lecture. It facilitate learning material a lot. The explanations of the basic concepts are very clear and precise. Nothing superfluous and all that is really needed. And the explanation  of CSS positioning (generally speaking, a rather confusing topic) in this course is the best I've ever seen at all (lecture 6). 
The only thing that can be done to improve the course is to provide a list of resources for advanced study of each of the course topics.
Mark  is  very passionate about his course and this passion is passed on to the listener. I enjoy the learning, a lot of thanks Mark for the course.

results.content: This is a very easy paced course for a very complex topic.  CSS has exploded with all the different syntax that is available for CSS3.  This in-depth course explains everything with working examples and provides exercises to reinforce the lessons.   A good course for people new and experienced with CSS.

results.content: I really enjoyed this class. It is a beginner level course that gets you to investigate more of css than is gone over once you start seeing what you can do with it. If you never had any css exposure, this is a good way to see what you can do with it. Many topics covered and the labs are good. I found that I would like to do more in the labs than the required skills it was addressing. It was fun to do. If you already know how to use css this might be a little too basic for you. The chapters aren't too long to go over a topic or two so they don't drag on. The labs are specific to the video you watch, but you can combine what you already learned in previous lessons and other things you may find while investigating deeper into css to make them more complex just for the sake of learning. So if you're new to css, this is a good place to start.

results.content:
This is fantastic! I have already participated in several Framework TV courses, and I always emphasise that Mark is a great instructor. Each element of the course is perfectly described, explained and logically connected with others. What is perhaps most important is Mark's visible passion for teaching us what he presents on the screen.
The course itself is undoubtedly intended for beginners. Nevertheless, in the subsequent lessons, we learn more and more complex issues - all explained in the same very accessible way. And each of them will be useful if we want to have full control over our site.
Some minor comments and suggestions:
1. One would like to see one more lesson presenting useful tricks connected with sending correspondence directly from the website, more ways of animating, creating various special effects, "pop-up" announcements while watching the site etc.
2. I think that because the course is for beginners, Mark could start it by discussing the possibilities of the Brackets editor.
3. Under "course requirements or prerequisites" is the note: "No Special Software Needed" - I guess it would be useful to mention exactly Brackets here.

results.content:
CSS is designed to enhance html files like selecting fonts, colors, do image handling, animations and so on.
This course is presented by Mark Lassoff whose videos are always very pleasant to watch (fluent, no hesitations). He will cover a large number of very helpful CSS properties.
Mark's philosophy is that you only learn by practicing. Therefore every episode has an exercise that has to be sent in and will be checked by the staff. When all exercises are OK you get the certificate and will be able to generate high class html/CSS projects. There are downloadable text files wherein the subjects are extensively covered.
Highly recommended.

results.content: Its a great course if you have a little knowledge of CSS and its very practical with  lot of really useful tips even for advanced users. It covers the modern CSS possibilities and the crucial things to know about box model and responsive design. The last video to do an animation with sprite sheets is a very alive way to understand them i only used them for icons logos etc. I recommend to take this course also on framework television there is additional material and exercises that are challenging and fun to do they improve the hole understanding a lot.
